Filter Effects

Filter Effects is a module of CSS that defines a way of processing an elementâ€™s rendering before it is displayed in the document.

Reference

Properties

  • backdrop-filter
  • filter

Data types

  • <filter-function>

Specifications

Specification Status Comment
Filter Effects Module Level 1
The definition of 'filter' in that specification.		 Working Draft Initial definition.

In Chrome 18 to 19, the saturate() function only takes integers instead of decimal or percentage values. From Chrome 20, this bug is fixed.
